page.title: 05The Railway Home,Woking.
page.content: One of the first sights to be seen from the train as it approaches Woking from London is a large red brick building in pleasant grounds. The Southern Railwaymen's Homes for Children and Old People in Oriental Road were originally built as a result of contributions from railway workers to provide a Home for any children who were orphans of railway workers. In later years due to the reduction in fatal accidents to railway workers there was not a need for such a large Home and it became a Convalescent Home for railwaymen and their families. It now offers self-contained homes to ex-railway staff and their families after retirement, is a convalescent home and houses children in need. Several refugee families from Vietnam were housed there on their arrival in this country.
